isis.stitle: TSI 94-05-01 - Relocate Power Steering Fluid Reservoir

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 2000 and 8000 Models with all engines and power steering.

Beginning on March 21, 1994, Navistar relocated the power steering fluid reservoir on 2000 and 8000 model vehicles with all engines and power steering, from the side of the radiator to the frame ( Figure 1). This change was made to remove stress on the radiator and to improve accessibility to the reservoir fill opening.

calloutgroup.callout1: 9. POWER STEERING RESERVOIR ASSEMBLY MOUNTING BRACKET

geninfo.para: The procedure to perform this modification is divided into two sets of instructions. The first set of instructions has parts and installation information to relocate the power steering fluid reservoir from the radiator to the frame. The second set of instructions has parts and installation information to replace fittings and hoses for the relocated reservoir.

table.title: Parts Information For Mounting Power Steering Pump Reservoir in New Location

entry.para: Bolt, Hex Flg. Hd. 1/2" -20 x 1-1/2" Gd 8
**Nuts and washers must be installed from inside the frame.

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. RESERVOIR BRACKET MOUNTING BOLTS AND NUTS
5. RESERVOIR ASSEMBLY BRACKET MOUNTING BOLT AND NUT
6. RESERVOIR ASSEMBLY BRACKET MOUNTING NUTS AND WASHERS
7. CAB SUPPORT ROD BRACKET MOUNTING BOLTS, FLAT WASHERS AND NUTS

table.title: Parts Information For Fluid Lines and Fittings Installation on 8200 With Detroit Diesel Series 60 and Caterpillar 3406C Engine

Parts Information For Fluid Lines and Fittings Installation on 2554 and 2654 With a DT-466 Engine; 2574, 2674 and 8200 With an NGD 530, Cummins L10, M11, N14 or Caterpillar 3176 Engine; and 8100/8100CH With DT-466, NGD 530, Cummins L10, M11, or Caterpillar 3176 Engine

entry.para: Elbow, 45° x 3/4" Hose, for use with DT and NGD engines. Use 90° elbow for 14,000 lb. axle. See Table 4.
Elbow, 45° x 3/4" Hose, for use with L10, M11, 3176 and N14 engines. Use 90° elbow for 16,000 lb. axle. See Table 4.

table.title: Parts Information For Fluid Lines and Fittings Installation on 2574 and 2674 With an NGD 530 Engine, 14,000-Lb. Front Axle With a Single Steering Gear - 16,000, 18,000 and 20,000-Lb. Front Axle With Dual Steering Gears
Parts Information For Fluid Lines and Fittings Installation on 2574 and 2674 With an NGD 530 Engine, 10,000 and 12,000-Lb. Front Axle With a Single Steering Gear

step1.para: Place a container under the power steering gear and remove the fluid feed line into the power steering pump and the fluid return line from the steering gear. Allow the fluid to drain out of the reservoir and these lines. Plug or cover both of the openings where lines were removed to prevent foreign material from entering the pump and gear.
Remove the radiator support rod bracket from the side of the radiator. Discard the mounting bolts. Do not remove the support rod from the bracket ( Figure 1, Prior to March 21, 1994).
Remove reservoir along with the two lines, reservoir bracket and reservoir bracket reinforcement ( Figure 1, Prior to March 21, 1994) from the radiator and discard.

note.para: On 8100 Series vehicles with ether start, the reservoir bracket and reinforcement should stay on the radiator.

step1.para: Re-install the radiator support rod bracket on the side of the radiator ( Figure 1, Prior to March 21, 1994) with three 5/16" -18 UNRC-2A x 3/4" bolts ( Item 8, Parts list). Tighten to 140 to 190 in-lbs. (16 to 21 Nm).
Remove the cab support rod bracket from the frame. Do not remove the support rod from the bracket ( Figure 7). Discard the bolts and nuts.

Pull the cab support rod bracket away from the frame far enough to slide the power steering reservoir assembly mounting bracket ( Item 4, Figure 2) between the cab support rod bracket and the frame. Fasten the reservoir assembly mounting bracket to the frame with the same bolts ( Item 7, Parts List) used to secure the cab support rod bracket to the frame ( Figure 1 and Figure 8). Tighten to 70 to 80 ft-lbs. (95 to 108 Nm).
Use the power steering reservoir assembly mounting bracket as a template and drill a 17/32 inch hole through the frame in the location shown in Figure 9.
Install a 1/2-20 x 1-1/2 inch flanged head bolt ( Item 5, Parts List) in the drilled hole. Secure with a 1/2-20 flanged hex lock nut. Tighten to 100 to 120 ft-lbs. (136 to 163 Nm).

Install the power steering pump reservoir mounting bracket ( Item 2, Parts List) to the reservoir assembly mounting bracket ( Item 4, Parts List) as illustrated in Figure 10. Secure with 5/16" -18 hex nuts and washers ( Item 6, Parts List). Tighten to 215 to 265 in-lbs. (24 to 30 Nm).

Install the power steering reservoir assembly ( Item 1, Parts List) to the power steering pump reservoir mounting bracket ( Figure 10). Secure with 3/8" -16 x 1-1/2" hex hd bolts and prevailing torque hex lock nuts ( Item 3, Parts List). Tighten to 30 to 38 ft-lbs. (41 to 51 Nm).

note.para: Reservoir has locator welded to can. Put in outboard hole of clamp to locate can hose nipple ( Figure 10).

svcproc.title: FLUID LINES AND FITTINGS INSTALLATION
svcproc.para: Replacement of the power steering reservoir requires replacement of some of the fluid lines and fittings. Fluid lines and fittings installations vary by model, engine and axle combination. Refer to Table 2, Table 3, Table 4, or Table 5 and the respective figures for how the fluid lines and fittings are to be installed on all the applicable vehicles.

important.para: After installing all hoses and filling the system with power steering fluid, bleed the system following the procedure outlined in GROUP 05 - STEERING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. After bleeding the system, check for and repair all leaks.
